User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0.1
Build ID: 20110707182747

Steps to reproduce:

while focus is on a content-editable div, typing a ' (i.e in a contraction) fires quickfind (links).

In this case, I was using basecamp.


Actual results:

focus was removed from the container and the quickfind (links) box appeared. Functionally making it impossible to use the single-quote/apostrophe key while typing.


Expected results:

if a content-editable container has focus, the quickfind keymaps should be ignored.
comments.author: matt@couldbestudios.com

comments.raw_text:
The problem seems to be inconsistent. 

I don't have a good test case, this came up today while responding to a basecamp thread. 

Before reporting the bug I tried replying to other threads and had the same problem (typing the word "don't" in the middle of a sentence triggered quickfind).

I tried to duplicate the problem just now and could not duplicate it most times.

I suppose it's possible something in their javascript could have been interfering with the normal behavior.

The behavior shown in this old post (not mine) is the same as what I was experiencing.

http://foliovision.com/2007/11/06/firefox-quickfind
